title: (Consequential Provisions) Act (No. 23 of 2020)) of the International Protection
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the International Protection Act
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the International Protection Act 

2015 (Return Order) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 January 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited international protection act 2015 (return order) regulation 2020 (2) regulation shall come operation 1 january 2021

title: (Consequential Provisions) Act (No. 23 of 2020)) of the International Protection
heading: 2. The form set out in the Schedule is hereby prescribed for the purposes of
text_raw:
2. The form set out in the Schedule is hereby prescribed for the purposes of 
subsection (5) of section 51A (inserted by section 121 of the Withdrawal of the 
United Kingdom from the European Union (Consequential Provisions) Act 2020 
(No. 23 of 2020)) of the International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66 of 2015). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [726] 3

title: (Consequential Provisions) Act (No. 23 of 2020)) of the International Protection
heading: RETURN ORDER
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

RETURN ORDER 

WHEREAS it is provided by section 51A of the International Protection Act 
2015 (No. 66 of 2015) that, subject to the provisions of section 50A (prohibition 
of refoulement (application for international protection determined under section 
21 to be inadmissible)) of the Act, the Minister for Justice shall by order require 
a person whose application for international protection has been determined 
under section 21(11) to be inadmissible to leave the State; 

WHEREAS ........................ [insert name of person] is a person to whom 
subsection (1) of section 51A applies and in respect of whom a return order shall 
be made under subsection (1) of the said section 51A; 

AND WHEREAS the provisions of section 50A (prohibition of refoulement 
(application for international protection determined under section 21 to be 
inadmissible)) of the International Protection Act 2015 are complied with in the 
case of .......................... [insert name of person], 

NOW, I, ............................., Minister for Justice, in exercise of the powers 
conferred on me by subsection (1) of section 51A of the International Protection 
Act 2015, hereby require you the said ................................ [insert name of 
person] to leave the State and to return to ……………………… in accordance 
with the arrangements specified in the notice given to you under subsection (3) 
of the said section 51A. 

GIVEN UNDER my Official Seal this […………………………Insert date], 

_____________________Minister for Justice 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [726] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 December, 2020. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [726] 5

title: (Consequential Provisions) Act (No. 23 of 2020)) of the International Protection
heading: (This Note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This Note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations prescribe the Return Order to be issued under section 51A of 
the International Protection Act 2015. Section 51A was inserted by the 
Withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union (Consequential 
Provisions) Act 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [726]
